article.headline: Rider 70, Northeastern 69
article.story: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J. (AP) -- Terrance Mouton's layup with five seconds left allowed Rider to escape with a 70-69 win over Northeastern on Saturday. The Broncs (3-1) had led 64-54 with about five minutes remaining, but the Huskies (1-5) went on a 15-4 run and took the lead on Manny Adako's jumper with 17 seconds left. However, Mouton -- who briefly left the game in the second half after an inadvertent head butt opened a gash that required some stitches -- got the ball on the right side and gave Rider its third straight win. Rider held double-digit leads for most of the game, but had trouble putting away Northeastern, which went 9-for-25 from 3-point range. Adrian Martinez led the Huskies with a career-high 22 points on 7-of-16 shooting -- including 5-of-10 from 3-point range. Matt Janning added 13 points for Northeastern, while Adako finished with 12. Jason Thompson -- one of five Broncs in double figures -- had 12 points, nine rebounds and a career-high seven assists. Harris Mansell, Lamar Johnson and Ryan Thompson also had 12 points each, while Joel Green added a career-high 11 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
